intro: Barleria hystrix, commonly known as the spiked barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright blue or purple flowers that bloom throughout the warm seasons. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Barleria hystrix is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
